fhir_comments: an identifier used for this allergic propensity (adverse reaction risk)
text.div:
Generated Narrative with Details

id: example

identifier: 49476534

status: confirmed

type: allergy

category: food

criticality: high

substance: Cashew nuts (Details : {SNOMED CT code '227493005' = 'Cashew nut (substance)', given as 'Cashew nuts'})

patient: Patient/example

recordedDate: 09/10/2014 2:58:00 PM

recorder: Practitioner/example

reporter: Patient/example

onset: 01/01/2004

lastOccurence: 01/06/2012

note: The criticality is high becasue of the observed anaphylactic reaction when challenged with cashew extract.

reaction

substance: cashew nut allergenic extract Injectable Product (Details : {RxNorm code 'C3214954' = '??', given as 'cashew nut allergenic extract Injectable Product'})

certainty: confirmed

manifestation: Anaphylactic reaction (Details : {SNOMED CT code '39579001' = 'Anaphylaxis (disorder)', given as 'Anaphylactic reaction'})

description: Challenge Protocol. Severe reaction to subcutaneous cashew extract. Epinephrine administered

onset: 12/06/2012

severity: severe

exposureRoute: Subcutaneous route (Details : {SNOMED CT code '34206005' = 'Subcutaneous route (qualifier value)', given as 'Subcutaneous route'})

reaction

certainty: likely

manifestation: Urticaria (Details : {SNOMED CT code '64305001' = 'Urticaria (morphologic abnormality)', given as 'Urticaria'})

onset: 01/01/2004

severity: moderate

note: The patient reports that the onset of urticaria was within 15 minutes of eating cashews.

fhir_comments: this individual has had several reactions
note: it's often unknown whether an allergy is mediated by an immune response, and not as significant as once thought

this categorisation is implied by "cashew nut" and therefore basically 
    redundant, but many systems collect this field anyway, since it's either 
    useful when the substance is not coded, or it's quicker to sort/filter on
    than using terminology based reasoning
there is no question that the allergy is real and serious

substance - either coded, or text. A few times, 
    there's a full description of a complex substance - in these caes, use the
    extension [url] to refer to a Substance resource
the patient that actually has the risk of adverse reaction
the date that this entry was recorded
who made the record / last updated it
the patient is the reporter in this case
when the allergy was first noted (in this case the same as reaction.onset of the first occurrence)

last happened June 2012. Typically, systems either track lastOccurence,
     or a list of events.
an additional note about the allergy propensity by the recorder
note.text: The criticality is high becasue of the observed anaphylactic reaction when challenged with cashew extract.

fhir_comments:
past events. There's no claim that this is all the events, and 
     that should not be assumed

It's possible to list specific things to which the patient responded,
      e.g. chocolate (that happened to contain cashew nuts). This event has
      such a specific substance. Note that systems should ensure that what
      goes in here does not conflict with the substance above, and systems
      processing the data can be sure that what is here does not contravene
      the substance above

coding.display: cashew nut allergenic extract Injectable Product

reaction.description: Challenge Protocol. Severe reaction to subcutaneous cashew extract. Epinephrine administered

fhir_comments: an additional note about the reaction by the recorder
note.text: The patient reports that the onset of urticaria was within 15 minutes of eating cashews.
